benchmark_details.name: Software Heritage License Dataset (2022 Edition)
benchmark_details.overview: The dataset consists of a collection of 6.9 million unique license documents obtained from public code repositories, aiming to characterize software licenses and facilitate further research and analysis related to license terms.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective is to produce a comprehensive dataset that aids in understanding software licenses used in publicly available source code and to assist in the development of tools and methods for license detection and analysis.

data.annotation: Manual annotation combined with automated ScanCode analysis.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated through a combination of automated analysis using ScanCode and manual review of a random sample of the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Results are used to evaluate the completeness and usefulness of the dataset for licensing information analysis.
methodology.baseline_results: Accuracy of ScanCode was high, with 70% of licenses detected scoring 100 on the confidence scale.
methodology.validation: Sample validated through manual annotations and comparisons with existing license databases.
